intro: Comanthera harleyi, commonly known as the harley's ghostflower, is a rare and specialized plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. It has a unique reproductive strategy, relying on specific host plants for nutrients and water. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, Comanthera harleyi is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
